summary: Comprehensive frontend testing completed for My Dammaiguda civic engagement platform. Tested all 9 requested features: Dashboard widgets (AQI and Dump Yard), Kaizer Doctor page with medicine lookup and symptom checker, Citizen Benefits (vouchers tab removed), Course scholarship application, and Issue reporting. All features working correctly.

minor.issue: Returns 404 - API endpoint may not exist or require authentication

issues: Multiple 'Missing Description' warnings for DialogContent components - accessibility improvement needed

passed_tests: Dashboard AQI widget displays as rectangular full-width card - PASS
AQI shows value (220 Very Unhealthy) for Dammaiguda with Hyderabad comparison - PASS
Dashboard Dump Yard widget displays below AQI as rectangular card - PASS
Dump Yard widget shows health risks badges (Respiratory, Skin Issues, Water Contamination, Kidney) - PASS
Dump Yard page loads with Zones, Risks, Updates tabs - PASS
Dump Yard Risks tab shows health risks (Respiratory, Groundwater, Skin, Cancer) - PASS
Dump Yard Affected Groups displays properly (Children, Elderly, Pregnant Women, Workers) - PASS
Kaizer Doctor page loads without errors - PASS
Medicine search works - Paracetamol shows results with brand names, uses, dosage, side effects - PASS
Symptom checker tab works - clicking Fever shows causes, OTC medicines, home remedies - PASS
Course scholarship application form appears when clicking Apply for Scholarship - PASS
Scholarship form has all required fields (Name, Mobile, Age, Email, Education Level, Institution, Income, Reason) - PASS
Citizen Benefits page loads with Benefits tab only - PASS
Vouchers tab successfully removed from Citizen Benefits - PASS
Issue reporting page loads without errors with 3-step flow - PASS
critical_code_review_comments: Dashboard widgets (AQI and Dump Yard) properly implemented as rectangular full-width cards
Kaizer Doctor medicine database with 10 common medicines working correctly
Symptom checker provides helpful information for common symptoms
Scholarship form properly integrated with course detail page for paid courses
Vouchers tab correctly removed from CitizenBenefits.jsx
Minor: DialogContent components missing aria-describedby for accessibility

test_credentials.otp: 123456 (MOCKED - displayed as Dev OTP in UI)

context_for_next_testing_agent: All requested UI/UX improvements verified working: 1) AQI widget is rectangular full-width card with status badge, 2) Dump Yard widget is rectangular card below AQI with health risks badges, 3) Dump Yard page shows detailed health risks and affected groups with proper icons and risk levels, 4) Kaizer Doctor has medicine database search and symptom checker tabs working, 5) Scholarship application form appears on paid course detail pages with all required fields, 6) Vouchers tab removed from Citizen Benefits - only Benefits and My Applications tabs remain, 7) Issue reporting page works with 3-step flow (category, details/media, location/submit). OTP authentication uses static 123456 (displayed as Dev OTP).

mocked_apis.otp_authentication: Uses static OTP 123456 (displayed as Dev OTP in UI)
mocked_apis.media_uploads: Issue reporting uses mock URLs for media uploads

aqi_widget.content: Shows AQI value, status badge, Hyderabad comparison, PM2.5

dumpyard_widget.design: Rectangular card below AQI with gradient background

health_risks: Higher cancer risk in surrounding areas

kaizer_doctor.medicine_search: 10 medicines in database (Paracetamol, Ibuprofen, Azithromycin, etc.)
